result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Kyle Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Robert A Kennedy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the Forest, County of. Called at 10:00 AM. Also called 15CM130 and all citations. State filed the motion - motion to re-open and vacate the judgments on referenced cases. Kennedy states he did not receive the motion and was not sure what it was about. Court explains what motion is about and the need to re-open the cases,  no proper findings at time of last hearing. Court will allow Kennedy a chance to disucss the matter with his client. Court sets all matters for a motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher Kyle Phillips in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:50 PM. 15TR322, 323, 324, 352, 353, 481, 482, 483, 530, 539, 15CM129 and 15CM130. Kennedy - all files be combined and wanted to have an agreement on all cases as one and is missing some information. State has provided discovery in the criminal matters and citations DA is not sure what discovery may have been sent out. Kennedy indicates he does not have breath test results. 15TR530 was a refusal and no request was filed, court will set for refusal hearing on 11/19/2015 at 9:00 AM. 15CM29 1/7/16 and 15CM130 1/8/2016. Judge instructs new jurors should be assigned for each day.  Jury trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am. Case recalled - same appearances as previously stated. Global resolution. State recites agreement. 15CM130 - plead as alleged to only count withhold sentence and place on probation for 12 months with conditions of no consumption/possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars/taverns, 50 hours community service, emp/school. Phillips pleads NC to count 1 as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering plea and waiving right to JT freely, voluntarily and intelligently, accepts plea and adjudges guility of count 1 as alleged. Nothing further from either party. Court sentences to following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of costs (paid thru probation), no consumption/possession of alcohol, no entry into bars/taverns, 50 hours community service, emp/school. Appeal rights. Adjourned

Defendant Christopher Kyle Phillips in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:02 PM. Also called 15CM130. Kennedy has complaints in both matters, waives reading of both complaints, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues bonds, accepts pleas, set both matters for FPT. Track all traffic matters as STC on same date and time.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

No consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns and no operation of a motor vehicle.

Defendant Christopher Kyle Phillips in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:40 AM. Also called 15CM129. Phillips handed criminal complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Phillips wants an attorney - will hire his own - can afford his own. Court continues bond, sets both matters for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm. State wants to review bond conditions for stated reasons, would like to add condition on each case of no operation of a motor vehicle. Court adds that condition to each bond, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns and no operation of a motor vehicle. Attorney Kennedy to contact court immediately if he is representing the defendant.
